Former French president François Hollande: 'Trump's plan reduces Europe's role to a besieged bystander'
subhead: In an interview with Le Monde, the former French president argued that 'for Trump, our continent is finished, it no longer counts,' and warned that if Zelensky 'falls, it is our own security that will be compromised. Sooner or later, we too will fall.'

title: The French far right and the 'enemies within'
US and Ukraine report 'good progress' in Geneva talks on ending the war
COP30's unambitious agreement preserves multilateralism but overlooks the climate emergency
subhead: The delegations from 194 countries gathered in Belem, Brazil, approved greater financial support for climate adaptation but fell short of adopting a binding plan to phase out fossil fuels or meaningfully raise overall ambition.

title: South Africa salvages the reputation of a faltering G20 summit
subhead: Boycotted by the United States, the summit still managed to adopt a final declaration. 'The G20 may be reaching the end of a cycle,' Emmanuel Macron wondered.

title: Israel says it killed Hezbollah's chief of staff in Beirut strike
subhead: The airstrike ordered by Prime Minister Netanyahu hit a residential block in Beirut's southern suburbs, killing at least five people and wounding 28. It was the first such attack on the city since June.

title: Five winter walks by the sea in France
subhead: Le Monde is taking you on a trip. Let's go to the island of Ouessant, Argelès, Lacanau, Saint-Malo and Mont-Saint-Michel, popular destinations for summer visitors, but just as attractive in winter. And you will (almost) be the only ones to enjoy it.

'Elon Musk and Mark Zuckerberg's love of Ancient Rome hides a secret fascination with imperialism'
subhead: While major tech leaders claim to see Ancient Rome as a moral and political model, it is likely because the civilization celebrated great individuals and praised boldness, historian Stéphane Ratti argues in an op-ed for Le Monde.

title: 'He looked me up and down': Hostesses, flight attendants and waitresses speak out about everyday sexualization
subhead: Crude jokes, inappropriate stares and overt flirting are commonplace for women in service jobs where physical appearance is paramount. Employees remain poorly protected from this sexualization, which can amount to harassment.

title: The fall of Northvolt, Sweden's symbol of green reindustrialization
subhead: On March 12, the electric battery giant shut its doors for good. Nearly 5,000 people employed at the Skelleftea gigafactory lost their jobs. As the US-based company Lyten prepares to restart production, Northvolt's downfall has cast a chill over Sweden's ambitions to reindustrialize around clean technology.
